questions.question: The paragraphs section lists only 6 high-level paragraphs (0000-MAIN-PROCESSING, 1000-INITIALIZE, 2000-EXPORT-CUSTOMERS, 3000-EXPORT-ACCOUNTS, 6000-FINALIZE, 9999-ABEND-PROGRAM), but many sub-paragraphs are missing such as 1050-GENERATE-TIMESTAMP, 2100-READ-CUSTOMER-RECORD, 3100-READ-ACCOUNT-RECORD, 4100-READ-XREF-RECORD, etc. Why aren't these included for completeness?

In data_flow.reads_from, fields_used lists only a subset of fields for each input file. For CUSTOMER-INPUT, only 6 fields are listed (citation 260,282), but lines 283-299 MOVE additional fields like CUST-MIDDLE-NAME, CUST-ADDR-LINE-2/3, CUST-ADDR-STATE-CD, etc. Similar gaps for ACCOUNT-INPUT (lines 352-363), XREF-INPUT (416-417), TRANSACTION-INPUT (471-483), CARD-INPUT (536-541). What about documenting all mapped fields?

Line 92 explicitly defines 01 EXPORT-OUTPUT-RECORD PIC X(500) in FILE SECTION without a COPY. However, code INITIALIZEs EXPORT-RECORD (line 271), MOVE fields to EXPORT-REC-TYPE etc (presumably in EXPORT-RECORD), and WRITE EXPORT-OUTPUT-RECORD FROM EXPORT-RECORD (line 301). CVEXPORT copybook (line 96 in WORKING-STORAGE) defines EXPORT-RECORD, not EXPORT-OUTPUT-RECORD. Does the documentation in outputs and copybooks_used accurately reflect this distinction?

All inputs and output are documented as io_type 'FILE_VSAM', which matches ORGANIZATION IS INDEXED (lines 36,42,48,54,60,66). However, EXPORT-OUTPUT uniquely specifies RECORDING MODE IS F RECORD CONTAINS 500 CHARACTERS (lines 90-91), suggesting fixed-length records unlike input copybooks. Is there any difference in handling or should io_type distinguish it?

In paragraphs.9999-ABEND-PROGRAM, called_by lists only three callers (1100-OPEN-FILES, 2100-READ-CUSTOMER-RECORD, 2200-CREATE-CUSTOMER-EXP-REC), but source shows PERFORM 9999-ABEND-PROGRAM from many more locations including account read/write (lines 334,369), xref (398,424), transaction (453,489), card (518,547), and export open (239). Why incomplete?

What about documenting the file organization (INDEXED), access mode (SEQUENTIAL), and record keys for inputs/outputs? E.g., CUSTOMER-INPUT has ORGANIZATION IS INDEXED ACCESS MODE IS SEQUENTIAL RECORD KEY IS CUST-ID (lines 36-38), similarly for others including EXPORT-OUTPUT RECORD KEY EXPORT-SEQUENCE-NUM (line 68)?

Line 92 defines EXPORT-OUTPUT-RECORD PIC X(500) in FILE SECTION. COPY CVEXPORT at line 96 in WORKING-STORAGE defines EXPORT-RECORD (used in INITIALIZE/MOVE/WRITE FROM). copybooks_used.CVEXPORT description includes 'file status areas, control vars, timestamps, statistics counters' but lines 98-145 define those explicitly after the COPY. Does CVEXPORT define only EXPORT-RECORD layout, with others hardcoded?

In paragraphs.9999-ABEND-PROGRAM.called_by, lists only a few examples with '* similar' abbreviation. For completeness, what about listing all or noting it's called from every file OPEN/READ/WRITE error (e.g., additional lines 334,369,398,424,453,489,518,547)?

All files documented as io_type 'FILE_VSAM' matching INDEXED organization, but EXPORT-OUTPUT uniquely has RECORDING MODE IS F RECORD CONTAINS 500 CHARACTERS (lines 90-91), while inputs use copybook-defined records. Does this warrant distinguishing io_type or noting fixed-length handling?

BR002 describes 'incrementing sequence counter starting from 0' (line 123 VALUE 0), but first usage adds 1 (line 276) before MOVE, so exported sequence numbers start at 1, never 0. Is the documentation precise?
